headline.main: ONE WEEK LATER FROM EUROPE.; ARRIVAL OF THE AMERICA AT HALIFAX. ARRIVAL OF THE UNION AT THIS PORT. ANOTHER GREAT RUSSIAN DEFEAT. 30,000 TURKS HAVE CROSSED THE DANUBE. THE RUSSIANS RETREATING ON BUCHAREST. PRUSSIAN AND AUSTRIAN CONFERENCE. Important Movements in the Black Sea. REPORTED FALL OF BOMARSUND. Great Slaughter on Both Sides. SPAIN MORE TRANQUIL. Espartero at Macrid. COUP D'ETAT AT COPENHAGEN. Republican Demonstration at Paris. Cotton Steady--Breadstuffs firm--Consols 92 1-2.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Royal Mail steamship America, Capt. LANG, from Liverpool on the 5th inst., arrived at this port about 5 o'clock this evening. THE EASTERN WAR. The news from the Danube continues generally favorable to the allies,--but nothing decisive has taken place.

headline.main: NEW--YORK CITY.; ATTEMPT AT SUICIDE. DISORDERLY HOUSE. ROWDY ATTACK ON A ENGINE COMPANY. SEVERE ACCIDENT TO A SOMNAMBULIST. PRIVATE EXCURSION TO MEET GRIST AND MARIO. THE CHOLERA. MR. FLAGG'S REPORT.

NEW-YORK CITY.; Sending a Challenge--Arrest. The Case of Peverelly. Odd Follows' Election. The State Agricultural Fair. The Trade Sale. THE CHOLERA. Eric Railroad. ATTEMPTED THEFT IN A BANK. THE CASE OF COOK, THE SAILOR. ACCIDENT FROM BURNING-FLUID. CHARGE OF CONSTRUCTIVE LARCENY. CHILDREN PLAYING WITH MATCHES. New-York Reporters ?? by "One of Them" The Steamship Franklin. Fatal Accident on the Hudson River Railroad. Fires. The Races. The North River Accident--Inquest. Combination of Trades-Unions. Crystal Palace. COMMON PLEAS--SPECIAL TERM. The Walker Divorce Case. COURT OF SPECIAL SESSIONS. Publication of Horrors. SUPERIOR COURT.

docs.lead_paragraph: We have the particulars of an unprovoked and atrocious outrage committed by a negro on the person of his master, Mr. E. O. JOHNSON, on the Spring Hill Road, about three miles from the city, on Saturday last.
docs.snippet: We have the particulars of an unprovoked and atrocious outrage committed by a negro on the person of his master, Mr. E. O. JOHNSON, on the Spring Hill Road, about three miles from the city, on Saturday last.

headline.main: LETTERS FROM ITALY---No. III.; What Austria is Doing in Italy--Mr. Van Buren in Italy--Commodore Stringham in the Mediterranean--Mr. Owen and our Diplomacy.

docs.lead_paragraph: It seems to be the fate of the Italian Peninsula that this beautiful "garden of the world" should ever form the battle-ground of contending interests and a foreign soldiery. In ancient times the shores of the Mediterranean attracted alike that civilized and barbarous groups of humanity.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the American Medical Monthly, for August. At the request of several apothecaries, and others interested in the preparation and sale of soda water, I have visited some establishments where the copper fountains are made and tinned, for the purpose of suggesting modifications which might prevent poisonous impregnation.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Meeting of the Farmers' Club--A steam-Plow. &e. AMERICAN INSTITUTE. The Fahechev Case--A Card from the Clerk of the Police Court. COMMON COUNCIL PROCEEDINGS, Board of Councilmen.--TUESDAY, Aug, 15. UNITED STATES COMMISSIONER'S OFFICE.

docs.lead_paragraph: A meeting of the Farmers' Club was held yesterday at the American Institute Building, No. 351 Broadway, GEO. P. RAPEALYE, Esq., in the Chair. Mr. HENRY COWING, of Louisiana, exhibited diagrams of a Steam-Plow. He went into minute detail, showing its practicability and the immense saving of human labor that would accrue from its general use.

headline.main: LATER FROM HAVANA.; New Decrees Miscellaneon Intelligence, &c.. Landing of More Slaves from American Vessels.

docs.lead_paragraph: By the arrival of the Philadelphia at New-Orleans and the Isabel at Charleston, we have advices considerably later from Havana. The letters of our correspondent contain various items of interest, and will be found below.
docs.snippet: By the arrival of the Philadelphia at New-Orleans and the Isabel at Charleston, we have advices considerably later from Havana. The letters of our correspondent contain various items of interest, and will be found below.

docs.lead_paragraph: NATHAN C. ELY, Esq., in the Chair. The minutes of the last meeting were read and approved. RESOLUTION ADOPTED. That the salary of the late N. B. Blue?, as District Attorney, for the fiscal year, this is from July 1, 1854. to January 1, 1855. be paid to George W. Blunt, Esq. administrator of his estate, and that the Compirolter draw his warrant for the amount. Adopted nom con.
